content.question: A small rock sits at the at the bottom of a cup filled with water. The upward force exerted by the water on the rock is <math alttext="F sub 0" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><msub><mi>F</mi><mn>0</mn></msub></math>. The water is then poured out and replaced by an oil that is <math alttext="three fourths" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mfrac><mn>3</mn><mn>4</mn></mfrac></math> as dense as water, and the rock again sits at the bottom of the cup, completely under the oil. Which of the following expressions correctly represents the magnitude of the upward force exerted by the oil on the rock?

choices.label: <math alttext="three fourths F sub 0" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle displaystyle="true"><mfrac><mn>3</mn><mn>4</mn></mfrac><msub><mi>F</mi><mn>0</mn></msub></mstyle></math>
<math alttext="four thirds F sub 0" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle displaystyle="true"><mfrac><mn>4</mn><mn>3</mn></mfrac><msub><mi>F</mi><mn>0</mn></msub></mstyle></math>
The answer cannot be determined without knowing the rockâ€™s volume.

content.answer: <math alttext="three fourths F sub 0" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle displaystyle="true"><mfrac><mn>3</mn><mn>4</mn></mfrac><msub><mi>F</mi><mn>0</mn></msub></mstyle></math>

skill.text: 2.D: Predict new values or factors of change of physical quantities using functional dependence between variables.
